titleStmt.title: Description of Free Library of Philadelphia, MS 484/18: Quaestiones in josue, judicum, regum, machabeis
titleStmt.funder: Council on Library and Information Resources

notesStmt.note: Front flyleaves are paper; the first end flyleaf is parchment, is numbered 57, ruled for 22 lines, with prickings visible; the other three end flyleaves are paper

msContents.summary: This manuscript is a twelfth-century copy of the Book of Joshua, with commentary.

msItem.title: Quaestiones in josue, judicum, regum, machabeis
msItem.author: Isidore, of Seville, Saint, -636

respStmt.persName: Vollbehr, Otto H. F. (Otto Heinrich Friederich), 1869-

supportDesc.extent: iii+56+iv; 194 x 128 mm bound to 203 x 144 mm

p.signatures: Visible at the end of quires, bottom center verso: 8v, 16v, 48v, 56v

layoutDesc.layout: One column of twenty-one lines; very light lead-point ruling; written area: 140 x 87 mm

decoDesc.decoNote: Red and blue initials throughout, ranging from two to six lines; red chapter numbers and titles throughout

history.provenance: Purchased in 1946 through the Bank of America from the collection of Otto H. F. Vollbehr
